Generation I.Red: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
Generation I.Yellow: Made of hardened sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
Generation I.Stadium: Sludge that was transformed when exposed to X-rays from the moon. Loves sludge, industrial waste and other refuse.

Generation II.Gold: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
Generation II.Silver: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.
Generation II.Crystal: When two of these Pok é mon 's bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
Generation II.Stadium 2: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Grimer 's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pok é mon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
Generation III.Sapphire: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pok é mon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.
Generation III.Emerald: Born from polluted sludge in the sea, Grimer 's favorite food is anything filthy. They feed on wastewater pumped out from factories.
Generation III.FireRed: Sludge exposed to X rays from the moon transformed into Grimer . It loves feeding on filthy things.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

Generation IV.Diamond: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation IV.Pearl: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation IV.Platinum: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation IV.HeartGold: As it moves, it loses bits of its body, from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.

Generation V.Black: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation V.White: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation V.Black 2: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
Generation V.White 2: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

Generation VI.X: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
Generation VI.Y: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.

Generation VII.Sun: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.
Generation VII.Moon: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Brought to Alola to solve the garbage problem, Grimer seems to relish any and all kinds of trash.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

Generation IX.Scarlet: They store their toxins inside their bodies, so unlike Grimer from other regions, they don’t smell bad even up close.
Generation IX.Violet: Alolan Grimer will gladly gobble up any kind of trash, making it a widely used and popular Pokémon at garbage disposal facilities.
